Description: Moderately prioritizes coastal and water-based food resources. Consider adopting when several coastal cities would benefit from improved naval food production.
Moderately prioritizes naval tile improvements like fishing boats and offshore platforms. Consider adopting when coastal cities have unimproved water tiles that could provide valuable resources.
[Not-available]

Moderately prioritizes faith output and religious unit production. Consider adopting when establishing or expanding a religion, especially after founding a pantheon or when civilization traits support religious development.

Substantially prioritizes settler production while sacrificing short-term development. Consider adopting in the early game when quality settlement locations are available nearby and competition for land is manageable.
[Not-available]
Overwhelmingly halts settler production. Consider adopting when quality settlement locations are exhausted or when facing severe happiness or military crises.
Moderately reduces land scout production. Consider adopting when exploration needs are met and further scout production would be redundant.
Overwhelmingly halts naval scout production. Consider adopting when ocean reconnaissance is complete or when military threats demand immediate attention.

Substantially prioritizes overseas colonization, naval production, and maritime development. Consider adopting when coastal infrastructure is established, embarkation is available, and valuable settlement opportunities exist on other continents with limited competition.
[Not-available]
Moderately prioritizes military production and offensive capabilities. Consider adopting when pursuing domination victory with sufficient resources and happiness for sustained warfare.
Substantially prioritizes cultural output, wonder construction, diplomat production, and population growth. Consider adopting when pursuing culture victory.
Moderately prioritizes diplomatic and economic output. Consider adopting when pursuing diplomatic victory.
Substantially prioritizes scientific research, territorial expansion, and spaceship production. Consider adopting when pursuing science victory.
Overwhelmingly prioritizes spaceship production while sacrificing diplomatic relations. Consider adopting after completing Apollo Program for accelerated science victory.
[Not-available]
Dramatically prioritizes naval production and maritime infrastructure. Consider adopting in early game when starting on small landmass with limited land-based opportunities.
Overwhelmingly halts military spending while dramatically increasing gold and trade route production. Consider adopting when facing severe financial crisis with treasury depletion imminent.
Moderately prioritizes maritime infrastructure and naval capabilities. Consider adopting when coastal cities comprise significant portion of population.
[Not-available]
Moderately prioritizes diplomat production. Consider adopting when valuable city-state opportunities present.
Substantially prioritizes diplomat production. Consider adopting when highly valuable city-state opportunities present, such as contested alliances or crucial World Congress votes.
[Not-available]
Moderately prioritizes happiness buildings while reducing expansion. Consider adopting when happiness margins are thin and unrest threatens productivity.
Overwhelmingly prioritizes happiness buildings while halting expansion and growth. Consider adopting when facing severe unrest.
Moderately prioritizes food production and tile improvements. Consider adopting when cities need population growth or face famine.
Moderately prioritizes production capacity and tile improvements. Consider adopting when cities need more production.
[Not-available]
Moderately prioritizes land scout production. Consider adopting during peacetime when exploration would reveal strategic opportunities.
Moderately prioritizes naval scout production. Consider adopting when ocean coverage is insufficient and military situation permits.
[Not-available]
Substantially prioritizes naval scout and fleet production. Consider adopting when ocean crossing is technologically available but naval reconnaissance is absent.
Moderately prioritizes faith output and religious infrastructure. Consider adopting when planning to increase faith output to support religious endeavors.
Moderately prioritizes counterintelligence defenses. Consider adopting when leading in research and vulnerable to technology theft by competing civilizations.

Overwhelmingly halts military production while moderately prioritizing economic output. Consider adopting when unit costs severely drain treasury or when facing bankruptcy with continued military spending.
[Not-available]
